sen.j: 佐藤 信寛（さとう のぶひろ 文化 (元号)12年12月27日 (旧暦)（1816年）1月25日 - 明治33年（1900年）2月15日）は、日本の武士（長州藩士）。
sen.e: Nobuhiro SATO (January 25, 1816 - February 15, 1900) was a samurai in Japan (a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain).
Nobuhiro SATO (January 25, 1816 - February 15, 1900) was a Japanese samurai (a feudal retainer of the Choshu clan).
Nobuhiro SATO (January 25, 1816 - February 15, 1900) was a Japanese samurai (a feudal retainer of the Choshu clan).

sen.j: 幼名は三郎､長じて寛作，又は信寛と名乗る。
sen.e: His childhood name was Saburo but later he changed it to Kansaku or Nobuhiro.
His childhood name was Saburo, later he called himself Kansaku or Nobuhiro.
His childhood name was Saburo, later he called himself Kansaku or Nobuhiro.

sen.j: 号は蝦洲。
sen.e: His pen name was Ebisu.
He called himself Kashu.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違い、「蝦洲」は「かしゅう」です。
sen.e: He called himself Kashu.

sen.j: 正五位。
sen.e: He was in Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank).
His last rank was Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank).
sen.cmt: この場合last rankのことです。
sen.e: His last rank was Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank).

sen.j: 佐藤家第10代当主。
sen.e: He was the 10th head of Sato Family.
He was the tenth head of the Sato family.
He was the tenth head of the Sato family.

sen.j: 元首相岸信介､佐藤栄作兄弟は曾孫。
sen.e: The Nobusuke KISHI and Eisaku SATO brothers were his great-grandsons.
The former prime ministers of Japan, Nobusuke KISHI and his brother Eisaku SATO were Nobuhiro's great-grandsons.
The former prime ministers of Japan, Nobusuke KISHI and his brother Eisaku SATO were Nobuhiro's great-grandsons.

sen.j: 子孫に安倍晋三元首相がいる。
sen.e: Ex-Prime Minister Shinzo ABE is his descendant.
The former prime minister Shinzo ABE is his descendant.
The former prime minister Shinzo ABE is his descendant.

sen.j: 現在の山口県熊毛郡 (山口県)田布施町に長州藩武士佐藤源右衛門（佐藤家第9代当主）の長子として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the eldest child of a Choshu Domain samurai Genemon SATO (the 9th head of Sato Family) in current Tabuse-cho, Kumage District, Yamaguchi Prefecture.
He was born as the oldest son of a retainer of the Choshu clan Genemon SATO (the ninth head of the Sato family) in current Tabuse-cho, Kumage County, Yamaguchi Prefecture.
He was born as the oldest son of a retainer of the Choshu clan Genemon SATO (the ninth head of the Sato family) in current Tabuse-cho, Kumage County, Yamaguchi Prefecture.

sen.j: 藩校明倫館に入り山県太華に学び、江戸にて清水赤城につき長沼流兵学を修め、吉田松陰に兵要禄を授けた。
sen.e: He entered Meirinkan Han School (Domain school) and studied under Taika YAMAGATA, then moved to Tokyo to study the Naganuma Style of Military Science under Sekijo AKAGI and gave Heiyoroku (short summary of military science) to Shoin YOSHIDA.

He entered Meirinkan domain school and studied under Taika YAMAGATA, then moved to Edo (Tokyo) to study the Naganuma-ryu school of military science under Sekijo SHIMIZU and taught Heiyoroku (short summary of military science) to Shoin YOSHIDA.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違い、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He entered Meirinkan domain school and studied under Taika YAMAGATA, then moved to Edo (Tokyo) to study the Naganuma-ryu school of military science under Sekijo SHIMIZU and taught Heiyoroku (short summary of military science) to Shoin YOSHIDA.

sen.j: 明治の初め浜田県権知事、島根県令等を務めた。
sen.e: He was the governor of Hamada Prefecture and the governor of Shimane Prefecture, etc.
He was the governor of Hamada Prefecture and the governor of Shimane Prefecture, etc.
He was the governor of Hamada Prefecture and the governor of Shimane Prefecture, etc.

sen.j: 明治11年（1878年）頃に官を退き、熊毛郡麻郷村戎ヶ下(現･田布施町)に居を定め、多くの詩編､手記を残し余生を風月と共に送った。
sen.e: He retired from his governmental position around 1878 and settled in Ebisugashita, Ogo Village, (current Tabuse-cho) Kumage District; he left many collections of poetry and personal notes, and he spent the rest of his life enjoying the companionship of nature.

He retired from his governmental position around 1878 and settled in Ebisugashita, Ogo Village, (current Tabuse-cho) Kumage County; he left many collections of poetry and personal notes, and he spent the rest of his life enjoying the companionship of nature.

He retired from his governmental position around 1878 and settled in Ebisugashita, Ogo Village, (current Tabuse-cho) Kumage County; he left many collections of poetry and personal notes, and he spent the rest of his life enjoying the companionship of nature.

sen.j: 86歳で死去、田布施のひろみが丘に葬られた。
sen.e: He died at the age of 86 and was buried in Hiromigaoka, Tabuse Town.
He died at the age of 86 and was buried in Hiromigaoka, Tabuse Town.
He died at the age of 86 and was buried in Hiromigaoka, Tabuse Town.

sen.j: 1876年11月信寛は県令として萩の乱の首謀者前原一誠らを逮捕している。
sen.e: In November 1876, as the governor, Nobuhiro arrested the ringleaders of the Hagi-no-ran War (turmoil of the dissatisfied warriors at Hagi) including Issei MAEBARA.
In November 1876, as the governor, Nobuhiro arrested the ringleaders of the Hagi-no-ran War (turmoil of the dissatisfied warriors at Hagi) including Issei MAEBARA.
In November 1876, as the governor, Nobuhiro arrested the ringleaders of the Hagi-no-ran War (turmoil of the dissatisfied warriors at Hagi) including Issei MAEBARA.

sen.j: 曾孫にあたる佐藤栄作は『今日は明日の前日』という自伝の冒頭に｢私の家はもともと毛利氏の家臣で萩市に住んでいた。（中略）曽祖父は毛利家本藩の直参だったのだがあまり格の高いものではなかったようだ。しかし､いまから考えると当時の革新派で毛利藩が九州に出兵した時などはその攻撃軍に加わっている。そんなことで明治維新の後は島根県の県令になった｣と書いている。
sen.e: His great-grandson Eisaku SATO wrote in his biography "Kyowa Ashitano Zenjitsu" (Today is the day before tomorrow) that 'My ancestors were originally vassals of the Mori clan and were living in Hagi City. (...) My great-grandfather was serving directly for the main Mori clan but he was not in a high rank. Yet, thinking about it now, he was a reformist at that time and when the Mori clan went to fight in Kyushu, he joined in the attacking force. Then he became the governor of Shimane Prefecture after the Meiji Restoration."

His great-grandson Eisaku SATO wrote at the beginning of his autobiography "Kyowa Ashitano Zenjitsu" (Today is the day before tomorrow) that "my ancestors were originally vassals of the Mori clan and were living in Hagi City (omission), my great-grandfather was serving directly the main Mori clan, however he was not at a high rank, yet, thinking about it now, he was a reformist at that time and when the Mori clan went to fight in Kyushu, he joined in the attacking force, after the Meiji Restoration he became the governor of Shimane Prefecture."

His great-grandson Eisaku SATO wrote at the beginning of his autobiography "Kyowa Ashitano Zenjitsu" (Today is the day before tomorrow) that "my ancestors were originally vassals of the Mori clan and were living in Hagi City (omission), my great-grandfather was serving directly the main Mori clan, however he was not at a high rank, yet, thinking about it now, he was a reformist at that time and when the Mori clan went to fight in Kyushu, he joined in the attacking force, after the Meiji Restoration he became the governor of Shimane Prefecture."

sen.j: 長男信彦との仲は必ずしも円満ではなく鼓家をついだ次男の包武を最も可愛がって総ての資産や記念品類をこの次男に与えた。
sen.e: The relationship with his eldest son Nobuhiko was not always amicable, which caused him to favor his second son Takekane who succeeded the Tsutsumi family name and gave him all of his properties and memorabilia.
sen.cmt: 「包武」の読みは確実ではありません。
sen.e: The relationship with his eldest son Nobuhiko was not always amicable, which caused him to favor his second son Takekane who succeeded the Tsutsumi family name and gave him all of his properties and memorabilia.

The relationship with his eldest son Nobuhiko was not always amicable, which caused him to favor his second son Takekane who succeeded the Tsutsumi family name and gave him all of his properties and memorabilia.

sen.j: ところが鼓家の人々は田布施･佐藤家にさほど興味もなかったのでその記念品類は次々に売り払われてしまったという。
sen.e: However, people of the Tsutsumi family were not interested in the Sato family in Tabuse Town, so they sold all the memorabilia one after another.
However, people of the Tsutsumi family were not interested in the Sato family in Tabuse Town, so they sold all the memorabilia one after another.
However, people of the Tsutsumi family were not interested in the Sato family in Tabuse Town, so they sold all the memorabilia one after another.

sen.j: 官職を退任後､戎ヶ下の別荘に起居し「蝦洲」と号した。
sen.e: After retiring his government position, he settled in his holiday home in Ebisugashita and gave himself a pen name of 'Ebisu'.
After retiring from his government position, he settled in his country house in Ebisugashita and called himself 'Kashu.'
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違いがあります。
sen.e: After retiring from his government position, he settled in his country house in Ebisugashita and called himself 'Kashu.'

sen.j: 別荘には有栖川宮熾仁親王や伊藤博文等が立ち寄ったという。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya and Hirobumi ITO visited the holiday home.
The influential people including Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Taruhito and Hirobumi ITO visited the country house.
The influential people including Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Taruhito and Hirobumi ITO visited the country house.

sen.j: 長男 信彦
sen.e: Eldest son: Nobuhiko
Eldest son: Nobuhiko
Eldest son: Nobuhiko

sen.j: 二男 鼓包武（鼓家を継ぐ陸軍少将）
sen.e: Second son: Takekane TSUTSUMI (Army Major General and succeeded the Tsutsumi family name)
Second son: Kanetake TSUZUMI (Army Major General and succeeded the Tsuzumi family)
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違いがあります。
sen.e: Second son: Kanetake TSUZUMI (Army Major General and succeeded the Tsuzumi family)

sen.j: 三男 太郎（井上家を継ぐ陸軍少佐）
sen.e: Third son: Taro (Army Major and succeeded the Inoue family name)
Third son: Taro (Army Major and succeeded the Inoue family)
Third son: Taro (Army Major and succeeded the Inoue family)

sen.j: 孫 佐藤松介（医師）、佐藤寛造（医師）、池上作三（医師）、モヨ、さわなど
sen.e: Grandchildren: Matsusuke SATO (Doctor), Kanzo SATO (Doctor), Sakuzo IKEGAMI (Doctor), Moyo, Sawa, etc
sen.cmt: 「寛造」、「作三」は読みが不確定です。
sen.e: Grandchildren: Matsusuke SATO (doctor), Kanzo SATO (doctor), Sakuzo IKEGAMI (doctor), Moyo, Sawa and so on
Grandchildren: Matsusuke SATO (doctor), Kanzo SATO (doctor), Sakuzo IKEGAMI (doctor), Moyo, Sawa and so on

sen.j: 曾孫 岸信介（官僚､政治家･元首相）、佐藤栄作（官僚、政治家･元首相）
sen.e: Great-grandchildren: Nobusuke KISHI (bureaucrat, statesman and ex-Prime Minister), Eisaku SATO (bureaucrat, statesman and ex-Prime Minister)
Great-grandchildren: Nobusuke KISHI (bureaucrat, statesman and former prime minister), Eisaku SATO (bureaucrat, statesman and former prime minister)
Great-grandchildren: Nobusuke KISHI (bureaucrat, statesman and former prime minister), Eisaku SATO (bureaucrat, statesman and former prime minister)

sen.j: 佐藤家
sen.e: Sato family
Sato family
Sato family

sen.j: 佐藤家の祖先について、確証はないが、遠祖は源義経の家臣佐藤忠信であるという口伝がある。
sen.e: Although there is no confirmation or written record, it is said that the root of Sato family goes down to Tadanobu SATO, a vassal of MONAMOTO no Yoshitsune.
Although there is no confirmation or written record, it is said that the root of the Sato family ascend to Tadanobu SATO, a vassal of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、スペルミスがあります。
sen.e: Although there is no confirmation or written record, it is said that the root of the Sato family ascend to Tadanobu SATO, a vassal of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune.

sen.j: 確認できる佐藤家の初代は市郎右衛門信久といい、寛文2年（1662年）頃から萩藩の武士となり、扶持方2人・米2石4斗を受けた。
sen.e: The first member of Sato family in record was called Ichiemon-nobuhisa SATO, who was a samurai of Hagi Domain from approximately 1662 and received a salary to employ 2 people and 2 Koku 4 To (=930Kg) of rice.
sen.cmt: 「扶持方2人・米2石4斗」ですが、「扶持方2人」はおよそ558Kg、「米2石4斗」は372Kgのようです。
sen.e: On record, the founder of the Sato family was Ichiroemon Nobuhisa SATO, a samurai who had served the Hagi clan since about 1662 and received a rice stipend of 2 koku 4 to (432.936 cubic decimeters) for two members of the family.
sen.cmt: 計算ミス、訳語選択ミス、表記ミスがあります。
sen.e: On record, the founder of the Sato family was Ichiroemon Nobuhisa SATO, a samurai who had served the Hagi clan since about 1662 and received a rice stipend of 2 koku 4 to (432.936 cubic decimeters) for two members of the family.

sen.j: 下級武士であり、この待遇はその後もあまり変わらない。
sen.e: He was a lower-ranking samurai and there was not much change in his salary after that.
He was a lower-ranking samurai and there was not much change in his salary after that.
He was a lower-ranking samurai and there was not much change in his salary after that.

sen.j: 役によって4石5斗あるいは6石に加増されたこともある。
sen.e: Depending on his position, he sometimes received a salary of 4 Koku 5 To (=695Kg) or 6 Koku (=930Kg) of rice.
Depending on his position, he sometimes received a rice stipend of 4 koku 5 to (811.755 cubic decimeters) or 6 koku (1082.34 cubic decimeters).
sen.cmt: 計算ミス、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Depending on his position, he sometimes received a rice stipend of 4 koku 5 to (811.755 cubic decimeters) or 6 koku (1082.34 cubic decimeters).

sen.j: 代々、市郎右衛門あるいは源右衛門を名乗った。
sen.e: They called themselves Ichiroemon or Genemon successively.
The members of the family successively called themselves Ichiroemon or Genemon.
The members of the family successively called themselves Ichiroemon or Genemon.

sen.j: 歴代佐藤家の当主の中で世に出たのは、まず4代目の源右衛門信早である。
sen.e: The first head of Sato family who became famous in history was the fourth head Genemon-nobuhaya SATO.
The first head of the Sato family who became famous in history was the fourth head Genemon Nobuhaya SATO.
The first head of the Sato family who became famous in history was the fourth head Genemon Nobuhaya SATO.

sen.j: その功を認められて禄高を6石に加増されている。
sen.e: His effort was appreciated and his Rokudaka (salary) was increased to 6 Koku (930Kg) of rice.
He produced some achievement and his Rokudaka (salary) was increased to 6 koku (1082.34 cubic decimeters).
sen.cmt: 計算ミス、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He produced some achievement and his Rokudaka (salary) was increased to 6 koku (1082.34 cubic decimeters).

sen.j: 熊毛郡下田布施村の｢宝暦検地絵図｣などの文書も残した。
sen.e: He left some Monjo (written materials) such as 'Horei Kenchi Ezu' (Horei era land survey map) of Tabuse Village of Kumage District.
He left some written materials such as 'Horeki Kenchi Ezu' (Fields Atlas of the Horeki era) of Tabuse Village of Kumage County.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違いがあります。用語を統一します。
sen.e: He left some written materials such as 'Horeki Kenchi Ezu' (Fields Atlas of the Horeki era) of Tabuse Village of Kumage County.

sen.j: 7代目の佐藤嘉津馬は安永八年（1779年）12歳で病死する。
sen.e: The seventh head, Katsuma SATO died from an illness at the age of 12 in 1779.
The seventh head Katsuma SATO died from illness at the age of 12 in 1779.
The seventh head Katsuma SATO died from illness at the age of 12 in 1779.

sen.j: 佐藤家はこの7代まで現在の山口市南部にあたる大内町御堀の周辺に住んだ。
sen.e: Up until this seventh generation, Sato family was living around Mihori, Ouchi Town, currently the south of Yamaguchi City.
Until this seventh head, the Sato family had been living around Mihori, Ouchi-cho, the present southern part of Yamaguchi City.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Until this seventh head, the Sato family had been living around Mihori, Ouchi-cho, the present southern part of Yamaguchi City.

sen.j: 7代目の嘉津馬夭折の後、佐藤家は萩に住む一族吉田八兵衛の3男菊三郎に別の親戚福田某の娘を嫁に迎え、夫婦養子とする。
sen.e: After the seventh head, Katsuma's death, when Kikusaburo - the third son of Hachibei YOSHIDA, a family living in Hagi City - married to a daughter of other relatives of a Fukuda family, Sato family adopted the couple.

After the seventh head Katsuma had died young, the Sato family had their relatives in Hagi City, Hachibei YOSHIDA's third son Kikusaburo get married to other relatives the Fukuda family's daughter, and adopted the couple as successor.

After the seventh head Katsuma had died young, the Sato family had their relatives in Hagi City, Hachibei YOSHIDA's third son Kikusaburo get married to other relatives the Fukuda family's daughter, and adopted the couple as successor.

sen.j: 8代目市郎右衛門信孝であり、この信孝の時代から、佐藤家は田布施に移った。
sen.e: Kikuzaburo became the eighth head Ichiemon-nobutaka and he moved the Sato family to Tabuse Town.
The adopted son was the eighth head Ichiemon Nobutaka and he moved the Sato family to Tabuse Town.
The adopted son was the eighth head Ichiemon Nobutaka and he moved the Sato family to Tabuse Town.

sen.j: 佐藤信寛は長州藩士として御蔵元本締役、大検使役等を歴任、長沼流兵学を修め、幕末期の思想家吉田松陰に兵要録を授けた。
sen.e: Nobuhiro SATO held positions such as an Okuramoto-motojime-yaku (rice store manager) and the Daikenshiyaku (Head of inspection), etc, studied the Military Science of Naganuma style and gave Heiyoroku (short summary of military science) to Shoin MATSUDA, a thinker of the end of the Edo period.

As a retainer of the Choshu clan, Nobuhiro SATO successively held important positions such as Okuramoto-motojime-yaku (supervisor of managers of the tribute) and Daikenshi-yaku (head of inspectors) and so on; he studied Naganuma-ryu school of the military science and taught Heiyoroku (short summary of military science) to Shoin YOSHIDA, a thinker of the end of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、固有名詞写し間違いがあります。
sen.e: As a retainer of the Choshu clan, Nobuhiro SATO successively held important positions such as Okuramoto-motojime-yaku (supervisor of managers of the tribute) and Daikenshi-yaku (head of inspectors) and so on; he studied Naganuma-ryu school of the military science and taught Heiyoroku (short summary of military science) to Shoin YOSHIDA, a thinker of the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 明治になると、島根県県令、浜田県権知事等の要職に就いた。
sen.e: In Meiji period, he was appointed to important positions such as the governor of Shimane Prefecture and the governor of Hamada Prefecture.
In the Meiji period, he was appointed to important positions such as the governor of Shimane Prefecture and the governor of Hamada Prefecture.
In the Meiji period, he was appointed to important positions such as the governor of Shimane Prefecture and the governor of Hamada Prefecture.

sen.j: 信彦は山口県議会議員を2期務め、優れた漢学者でもあった。
sen.e: Nobuhiko was a councilor of Yamaguchi Prefecture for 2 terms and was a great scholar of the Chinese classics.
Nobuhiko served two terms as councilor of the prefectural council of Yamaguchi Prefecture and he was also a great scholar of the Chinese classics.
Nobuhiko served two terms as councilor of the prefectural council of Yamaguchi Prefecture and he was also a great scholar of the Chinese classics.

sen.j: 秀助は山口県庁に奉職し、勤めを辞めてからは酒造業を始めた。
sen.e: Hidesuke worked for Yamaguchi Prefectural Government and after quitting the job, he started a sake brewing factory.
Hidesuke worked for Yamaguchi Prefectural Government and after quitting the job, he started a sake brewing factory.
Hidesuke worked for Yamaguchi Prefectural Government and after quitting the job, he started a sake brewing factory.

sen.j: 佐藤家の家紋は"源氏車"である。
sen.e: The family crest of Sato is "Genjiguruma" (a cartwheel of ancient style court carriage).
The crest of the Sato family is "Genjiguruma" (a cartwheel of a cattle-drawn carriage).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。「源氏車」は翻訳者の指摘どおり昔のものですが、具体的に牛車のことです。
sen.e: The crest of the Sato family is "Genjiguruma" (a cartwheel of a cattle-drawn carriage).
